issues.title: Insurance Coverage Discrepancy
issues.message: Despite an approved pre-authorization for ₹500,000 and sufficient annual limits, the insurance has covered ₹0.00 of the ₹400,000 hospital bill. This contradicts the expected cashless coverage based on the approved pre-authorization, leaving a significant patient balance of ₹350,000.
issues.suggested_action: Immediately contact Red Insurance to investigate why the approved pre-authorization amount has not been applied to the bill. Clarify the reason for ₹0.00 coverage and the patient's balance. Verify if any deductibles, co-pays, non-covered services, or processing errors account for this discrepancy. Patient discharge cannot proceed from an insurance perspective until this is resolved.
evidence: Pre-authorization (PA-2024-00231) approved for ₹500,000. Total Hospital Bill: ₹400,000. Amount Covered by Insurance: ₹0.00. Patient's Balance: ₹350,000. Coverage Type: Cashless.

issues.title: Medication Order Pending Dispense
issues.message: Pharmacy order for Jondise (Ursodeoxycholic Acid) is pending and has not been dispensed for discharge.
issues.suggested_action: Follow up with pharmacy to expedite dispensing of Jondise.

issues.title: New Medication Order Not Dispensed
issues.message: Insulin Glargine is a new discharge medication with no corresponding dispensed pharmacy order. It needs to be ordered and dispensed.
issues.suggested_action: Place an urgent pharmacy order for Insulin Glargine and ensure it is dispensed prior to discharge.

issues.title: Potential Allergy Conflict: Acetaminophen and Liver Complaint
issues.message: Patient has a 'Liver complaint' allergy. Dolo-Crosine (generic: Acetaminophen Extended) is hepatotoxic and should be used with extreme caution or an alternative considered in patients with liver issues. The prescribed dosage of 654mg twice daily (1308mg/day) warrants careful review.
issues.suggested_action: Consult with the prescribing physician to review Dolo-Crosine (Acetaminophen) for a patient with a liver complaint. Consider an alternative pain relief medication or a lower, carefully monitored dose with liver function tests.

issues.title: Discharge Medication Payment Pending
issues.message: Payment for Dolo-Crosine is pending for discharge.
issues.suggested_action: Coordinate with patient/billing department to clear payment for Dolo-Crosine.

issues.title: Discharge Medication Payment Pending
issues.message: Payment for Jondise is pending for discharge.
issues.suggested_action: Coordinate with patient/billing department to clear payment for Jondise.

issues.title: Discharge Medication Payment Pending
issues.message: Payment for Insulin Glargine is pending for discharge.
issues.suggested_action: Coordinate with patient/billing department to clear payment for Insulin Glargine.

issues.title: Ambulance Transport Required
issues.message: Patient has Liver Cancer and Excess Panting, indicating a serious condition requiring medical supervision and monitoring during transport. An ALS ambulance is recommended to ensure patient safety and appropriate care.
issues.suggested_action: Proceed with booking an ALS ambulance from an available provider.

issues.title: Final Invoice Not Generated
issues.message: The final invoice for patient P00231 (Account ID: ACC-00231-2024) has not yet been generated. Discharge cannot proceed without a finalized invoice.
issues.suggested_action: Generate the final invoice to complete the billing process and enable patient discharge.

issues.title: Pending Billing Adjustments
issues.message: There are pending billing adjustments that need to be finalized. This includes an insurance pre-authorization pending approval and a dialysis procedure billing that is not yet finalized. These items may impact the final invoice.
issues.suggested_action: Expedite the approval process for the insurance pre-authorization and finalize all outstanding procedure billings to ensure an accurate and complete final invoice.

issues.title: Required Chest X-Ray Pending
issues.message: The required 'Chest X-Ray' test has a 'pending' status and has not been completed. Discharge cannot proceed until this test is completed and reviewed.
issues.suggested_action: Schedule and complete the Chest X-Ray immediately. Re-verify status upon completion.

issues.title: Critical RBC Count
issues.message: Patient's Red Blood Cell (RBC) count is critically low at 2.8 10^6/uL (reference range: 4.5-5.9 10^6/uL), which is below the critical threshold of 3.0 10^6/uL. This requires immediate medical attention.
issues.suggested_action: Consult with physician immediately regarding the critically low RBC count. Further investigation or intervention may be required before discharge.

issues.title: Critical Platelet Count
issues.message: Patient's Platelet count is critically high at 960 10^3/uL (reference range: 150-400 10^3/uL), which is above the critical threshold of 450 10^3/uL. This requires immediate medical attention.
issues.suggested_action: Consult with physician immediately regarding the critically high Platelet count. Further investigation or intervention may be required before discharge.

issues.title: Critical Hemoglobin Level
issues.message: Patient's Hemoglobin level is critically low at 8.2 g/dL (reference range: 13.5-17.5 g/dL), which is below the critical threshold of 10.0 g/dL. This requires immediate medical attention.
issues.suggested_action: Consult with physician immediately regarding the critically low Hemoglobin level. Further investigation or intervention may be required before discharge.
